TopicTitle: The Official Kerbin Cup Tournament Thread - Final Entries Posted

Articles.Content:
Directly from "I Think We Broke It" Headquarters: Our youtube specialists fine-tuning the video for this challenge, pushing their skills and craftmanship to the limit, using every trick in the book.

Edited June 25, 2014 by Wooks

Agreed. Even if the answer had been "yes" to including the out-of-game material, it would now have to be "no" since including it would giveaway the author. And just by asking, you indicate that your team's plans are such that said out-of-game material would be plausibly created for your entry, when there may be other entries that wouldn't be likely to have such material made in relation to them.

(by the way, sorry for the mini-spoiler. I hope this didn't give away anything, and I didn't mean to if so.)

You just gave away your team entry

I think you will need to detele any blueprints in the video

Guys, I've been asked this question through PM earlier, but I wanted to answer it here to clarify this. All footage featured in the challenge must be in game. No external footage and nothing you cannot achieve on your own sans-mods in the game.

Thanks for the clarification, Rowsdower!

Agreed. Even if the answer had been "yes" to including the out-of-game material, it would now have to be "no" since including it would giveaway the author. And just by asking, you indicate that your team's plans are such that said out-of-game material would be plausibly created for your entry, when there may be other entries that wouldn't be likely to have such material made in relation to them.

I've censored my request.

That being said: As I'm not technically in the Kerbal Cup, I think that there's no need for my entry to be indistinguishable from any other. I will likely post my entry on this page on Friday, which will make it abundantly clear that the video is mine. (I'm not sure that Rowsdower would accept displaying it with the other teams' videos if I'm really not part of any team.) So, I don't think that it's a big deal to mention the fact that my video may contain [CENSORED], as everyone will know which video is mine anyway.

I'm pretty clear on this but just wanted to make sure: No mods just means no mod parts? Or are visual mods included? I would think that the wording includes banning visual mods like Texture Replacer or EVE but I just wanted to make sure.

I've censored my request.

That being said: As I'm not technically in the Kerbal Cup, I think that there's no need for my entry to be indistinguishable from any other. I will likely post my entry on this page on Friday, which will make it abundantly clear that the video is mine. (I'm not sure that Rowsdower would accept displaying it with the other teams' videos if I'm really not part of any team.) So, I don't think that it's a big deal to mention the fact that my video may contain [CENSORED], as everyone will know which video is mine anyway.

Then you should be posting in the "Kerbin Cup Unofficial Team Entries": http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/83034-Kerbin-Cup-Unofficial-Team-Entries-Challenge-2

Avera9eJoe is doing a great job managing that thread and is running head to head with the official one.

Then you should be posting in the "Kerbin Cup Unofficial Team Entries": http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/83034-Kerbin-Cup-Unofficial-Team-Entries-Challenge-2

Avera9eJoe is doing a great job managing that thread and is running head to head with the official one.

I'll be doing that as soon as I have a valid entry. The reason that I posted my comment here is that it is easier for the moderators to see. I'm technically in Avera9eJoe's teams list, going as a solo participant.

Thanks for the heads-up though.
I'm finally working on the third part of my KSP movie (in my description ) and I'll be unable to do this challenge :/. Good luck all of you!

Quick Question: Do the sound effects and/or music have to be stock only as well?

EDIT: Answered. Sound effects and music are allowed.

Edited June 25, 2014 by Xacktar

Quick Question: Do the sound effects and/or music have to be stock only as well?

And, what about the visuals? Can we do color corrections on them? Add text? Motion-tracking and special effects? We understand that we can't use external footage you can't get within the game, but does that apply to animated textures for special effects?

EDIT: Answered. Nothing that enhances the stock footage is allowed.

Edited June 25, 2014 by Andrew Hansen
Quick, what's the deadline for submission?
I intend to vote for whichever goal is achieved by the most Rube Goldberg-esque contraption. After seeing the quality of entries in round 1, I fully expect to be floored by this round.

... sooo, last challenge was a thropy for the Kerbal Cup. And we were the only ones to make an actual CUP

https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/-1RGqx1u6vcQ/U6iy6BR5bhI/AAAAAAAAAfQ/hqWbYhzskF4/w1118-h620-no/cup+challenge.jpg

Needs more orange lights.

Needs more orange lights.

I don't think it has too many lights. The Jedi Team's entry had way more lights. Generally, the more lights the better - until everything is so bright you can no longer see anything.
No more YouTube themed challenges after this. Please.
it's being hell in the youtube team too!!

it's being hell in the youtube team too!!

Truth. This is me right now.

No more YouTube themed challenges after this. Please.
it's being hell in the youtube team too!!
Truth.

Man I thought I was the only one. The challenge is reaffirming my decision to take screenshots instead of videos for most of my missions. And I'm not even doing the hard parts.

We need more time, Rowsdower!

Still, less than 18 hours for the honest to god deadline, so freaking out is allowed.

I think we've got this in the bag. I can't tell you why, but we do.
